intro: Drymonia latisepala, commonly known as the broad-sepaled fern, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and striking, spatulate-shaped flowers. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as marshes and along riverbanks. Its unique morphology makes it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
